content: I can say that implementing these ideas in existing cities with established infrastructure would be challenging, but not impossible. upgrading public transportation systems, adding bike lanes, and creating mixed-use development may require significant investment and planning, but they can work well in reducing traffic congestion. however, it may be more challenging to introduce congestion pricing or reduce parking availability in existing cities, especially if people are used to relying on their cars for transportation. the success of these initiatives also depends on the willingness of city officials, residents, and other stakeholders to work together towards reducing traffic congestion. overall, it requires careful planning, political will, and public support to successfully implement changes to reduce traffic congestion in existing cities.
